intro: Scleranthus glomeratus, commonly known as clustered sickleweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red, blooming in summer. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, adapted to reduce water loss in dry environments. Scleranthus glomeratus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in sandy or gravelly habitats.
